senses.de: to find the answer or solution to a problem or question
senses.ex: She is determined to resolve the problem by herself.

Tips.title: Problem-solving
Tips.description: Use 'resolve' when referring to dealing with challenges or disputes.
Tips.example: The team resolved the issue quickly.

Tips.title: Positive Outcome
Tips.description: Implies a successful end, often after a difficult process.
Tips.example: After much debate, they finally resolved their differences.

senses.de: to make a serious decision or promise
senses.ex: He resolved to start exercising regularly from the new year.

Tips.title: Strong Intent
Tips.description: Indicates a firm decision, often a personal commitment.
Tips.example: She resolved never to make that mistake again.

Tips.title: Future Actions
Tips.description: Often used for actions one decides to take starting now or in the future.

senses.de: in music, to move from a discordant note or chord to a concordant one
senses.ex: In that piece, the dissonant chords resolve beautifully into a harmonic ending.

Tips.title: Musical Harmony
Tips.description: In music, 'resolve' expresses the transition from tension to harmony.
Tips.example: The melody resolves in a satisfying way.

senses.de: in science, to separate something into its component parts
senses.ex: The light was resolved into its spectral colors.

Tips.title: Analytical Separation
Tips.description: Use 'resolve' to mean separating complex mixtures into basic parts in scientific contexts.
Tips.example: The prism resolved the light perfectly.

senses.de: in computing, to convert a domain name into an IP address
senses.ex: The DNS server is used to resolve the website's domain name into its IP address.

Tips.title: Technical Conversion
Tips.description: Specific to IT, it means converting names to numerical addresses.
Tips.example: The system resolved the hostname quickly.

senses.de: a strong determination to do something
senses.ex: She showed great resolve in fighting the disease.

Tips.title: Inner Strength
Tips.description: Conveys a person's solid commitment or willpower to face challenges.
Tips.example: Her resolve was unbreakable despite the setbacks.

Conclude.wordDefinition:
Conclude means to reach a decision or come to a final judgement after considering all the facts. It is applicable when there is a need to make a final decision based on available information or evidence.

Conclude is about making a decision and resolve is about solving a problem.

Decide.wordDefinition:
The words decide and resolve both imply making a decision or arriving at a conclusion, but there is a subtle difference between them.

Decide is generally used when there are options to choose from or conflicting opinions, and you have to pick one. For instance, you might decide which restaurant to eat at, or which movie to watch on Netflix.

You decide when you're making a choice between options, and you resolve when you're finding a way to solve a problem or conflict.

Determine.wordDefinition:
Determine means to find out or decide something by examining evidence or facts. It's applicable when we need to figure out something or make a decision based on available facts.

For example, a doctor might determine the cause of a patient's illness by conducting tests and analyzing the results.

Determine is used when we need to figure out or make a decision, while resolve is used when we need to find a solution to a problem or conflict.

Fix.wordDefinition:
Fix means to repair or make something work correctly. It is applicable when something is broken or not working properly, and needs to be repaired.

In simpler terms, fix is about making something work again, while resolve is about finding a solution to a problem.

Rectify.wordDefinition:
Rectify means to correct or fix something that is wrong, while resolve means to find a solution to a problem or conflict.

Rectify is applicable when there is an error or mistake that needs to be corrected. For example, if you discovered that you made a mistake while calculating your math homework, you would need to rectify the mistake by finding and correcting the error.

Rectify is used when something needs to be corrected or fixed, while resolve is used when a problem or conflict needs to be solved.

Settle.wordDefinition:
The words resolve and settle both mean to sort out a problem or situation, but they are used in slightly different ways.

Settle is often used to describe finding a compromise or making an agreement in a situation that involves conflicting interests or demands.

For example, you might say that two parties settled a lawsuit out of court, or that a couple settled their differences after a disagreement.

Resolve is used when talking about finding a solution to a problem, while settle is used when talking about finding a compromise or agreement between conflicting parties.

Solve.wordDefinition:
The words resolve and solve are similar in meaning as they both refer to solving a problem, but there is a slight difference between them.

Resolve means to settle or find a solution to a problem or an issue. It implies finding a solution through negotiation or compromise.

For example: "We need to resolve this conflict peacefully and come to an agreement that works for everyone."

Solve means to find a solution to a problem through analysis, reasoning, or logic.

For example: "We need to solve this math problem by using the formula and the given data."

Resolve tends to refer to finding solutions to more complex or emotional problems, while solve tends to refer to finding solutions to more technical or analytical problems.

Work out.wordDefinition:
For example, you can resolve an argument with a friend by talking it out and coming to a mutual understanding.

The phrase work out means to come to a successful conclusion or solution after a period of effort or experimentation.

It suggests a trial-and-error approach to problem-solving. For example, you can work out a math problem by trying different methods until you find the correct answer.

However, resolve is more appropriate when the problem is serious or emotionally charged, while work out is more appropriate for practical or technical challenges.

quotes.Text: If the newspapers cut me up so much that I shall not venture before the world again, I have resolved to become a house painter; that would be as easy as anything else, and I should, at any rate, still be an artist!
quotes.Title: Polish Composer
quotes.Name: Frederic Chopin

quotes.Text: When you don't manage your life well, you become angry and frustrated as things don't go as intended, and our bad mood is a sign showing we were not able to resolve the conflict.
quotes.Title: Argentinian Psychologist
quotes.Name: Jorge Bucay

quotes.Text: When a truth is necessary, the reason for it can be found by analysis, that is, by resolving it into simpler ideas and truths until the primary ones are reached.
quotes.Title: German Philosopher
quotes.Name: Gottfried Leibniz

quotes.Text: The difficulties you meet will resolve themselves as you advance. Proceed, and light will dawn, and shine with increasing clearness on your path.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Jim Rohn

quotes.Text: I have resolved to pick one novel and just read it over and over again for the rest of my life, because I cannot remember anything anymore.
quotes.Title: British Actor
quotes.Name: Hugh Laurie

quotes.Text: The resolve of our great nation is being tested. But make no mistake, we will show the world that we will pass the test.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: George W. Bush

quotes.Text: The best way to resolve any problem in the human world is for all sides to sit down and talk.
quotes.Title: Tibetan Leader
quotes.Name: Dalai Lama

quotes.Text: Palestine is the issue, and until this issue is resolved, there can be no peace.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Hamza Yusuf

quotes.Text: Families in real life don't tend to resolve things neatly.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Drew Barrymore

quotes.Text: Wise to resolve, and patient to perform.
quotes.Title: Greek Poet
quotes.Name: Homer
